Name: Amulet of aegis of Sakhmet
Description: Votive or amuletic aegis, a form derived from the garlands around the head of a deity at the prow and stern of ceremonial boats. In this example the head of the deity above the semi-circle of garlands has been abraded, but enough survives to identify it as a lion-head. The lion was used in Egyptian religious iconography to depict goddesses such as Sakhmet embodying the fury of the sun-god, called 'eye of Re'. This aegis could come from a shrine to that goddess.
